conversations.content: On a night of the Frostwyrm, when the waning moon grins, I will descend upon the Lobel Art Museum to claim the painting ＂The Smiling Lady.＂ —The Blue Rose
The Blue Rose is here, just as she said!
The lights were out for just a moment, but she still managed to make off with ＂The Smiling Lady.＂ Damn it all!
She can't have gone far! Find her!
Sacrebleu, am I surrounded? Not bad, gentlemen. Not bad at all.
You're cornered, phantom thief! Now just hand over the painting nice and easy.
Non, but I cannot. Treasures must be delivered to their rightful places; this is the only way they can truly shine.
Ha! And where exactly would that be, you arrogant thief? Your bulging coffers?!
Ah, but arrogance has such a bad name. One must believe in oneself if you wish to make the impossible possible, non?
A smokescreen?! *cough* *hack*
And with that, au revoir, everyone!
C-Captain! Lapis is gone!
Damn! How could we let her escape?!
Rumors abound about the phantom thief Lapis. Also known as the Blue Rose, she is currently  terrorizing all of South Grastaea.
Some say she can disguise herself as anyone— man or woman, young or old—while others claim her true identity is that of a certain songstress. But regardless of rumor, one thing is certain...
＂The Smiling Lady＂ is the crown jewel of  our exhibit, and this museum is doomed without it!
D-Director, look! The painting is back!
WHAT?!
Goodness! That's ＂The Smiling Lady,＂ and no mistake. But when did she...?
Perhaps the rumor is true that the Blue Rose always returns what she takes.
Well, that's convenient for us. But if so, what point is there to her thievery?
An antique shop in the poorer quarter of town One of Lapis's hideouts
Do consider coming in the front door one of these days, apprentice.
Do not call me that, if you please. I am the Blue Rose now.
Well, you still look a bit green to me. Now then, how did your little errand at the museum go?
＂The Smiling Lady＂ is back where she  belongs—or rather, your forgery of her.
Your work is truly legendary. The staff has no idea it is a fake, and the museum will doubtless continue to turn a profit.
Flattery will at best net you a cup of tea. ...Now then, what of the real thing? Did you give it to its ＂true＂ owner?
They were so happy to see their mother's memento again, they wept. It was lovely.
After that painting was stolen by bandits, it was fenced so many times that the museum did not even realize it was purchasing stolen property.
Unless you've got some sort of official documentation, it's hard to prove it's yours. Normally the owner would have been out of luck.
But we make our own luck.
We stand up for those who have been robbed, extorted, or swindled and take back what is rightfully theirs.
That is the duty of the Blue Rose, which has been passed down to me.
You've a way with words, I'll give you that. But I wonder if you've really absorbed what that duty means.
Why do you say this?
The old Blue Rose never sent advanced warning like you do; they simply swapped the fakes with the real thing without anyone knowing they'd been robbed.
Making a big production out of things doesn't sit right with me. Perhaps you're just too used to the spotlight, what with your being a performer and all.
Those proclamations are bait. If it's known the Blue Rose is still active, it might just draw ＂them＂ out...
Which is how we will find our bitter enemies, Noir Magazin!
Just mind you don't get swallowed up along with your bait, my dear.
By the way, I've some info for you: Have you heard of a nouveau riche by the name of Radelle?
Of the Radelle Corporation? Of course.  They've become quite the player of late.
There's an abandoned mine in back of  Radelle's mansion that's been attracting quite the band of unsavory characters.
So small-time hoodlums are using tunnels as a hangout? Not so out of the ordinary.
Perhaps not a hangout, but an entrance? Rumor is, those old tunnels lead directly into the Radelle residence.
These hoodlums have been seen taking valuables into the tunnels, and I doubt they came by them legitimately.
Then you think Radelle is behind it?
Radelle could be a broker, or running some kind of black-market auction.
A black-market auction? Like my parents...
Merci, but that WAS valuable info. I'll look into it at once.
Goes without saying, but I'll say it: Don't take any chances, apprentice.
Oui oui. Of course.
Later that night The Radelle Estate
So the rumors were true—these tunnels DO lead straight into the mansion!
If I can find a room full of stolen goods, that will seal it.
*yawn* You know, when they said all we had to do was guard a room, I thought we got off easy, but I'm falling asleep here.
Hey, get it together! If Radelle saw you now...
What would I do, mmm?
M-Mr. Radelle! We didn't realize you were still up, sir!
When you're in my employ, I expect you to earn your pay. If you find yourself weary, I suggest you douse yourself with cold water to keep your attention firm.
Y-yes, sir!
Hmm. This is locked up tight. But not too tight for me...
Mon dieu! Look at all the valuables!
It will take some doing to get all of these out of here, so best to call it a night... But first, a note!
Who are you?
(A kid? One of Radelle's family?)
Bonsoir, mademoiselle. I am the one who makes the impossible possible: the phantom thief Lapis!
What are you doing here?
Why would a phantom thief be anywhere? The treasures in this room are so lovely I can scarce catch my breath.
So you're not working for that man? In that case...
Steal me away from this place!
Steal YOU?!
Steal me away from here.
Never been asked to steal a person before, but très bien...
Well now, isn't this exciting? Why don't you take a moment and fill me in on your entire story, my dear?
This shop is just one of many secret lairs I have across the continent, and I swear no one will ever find you here. Now then, how about a mug of hot cocoa?
Thank you.
So now you're stealing people? Well, I suppose you did learn from the best.
Be it works of art or children, if something needs rescuing, the Blue Rose is there
Heh, that's exactly what the last Blue Rose used to say... Anyway, who's the kid?
Her name is Aisha. Until recently, she lived with her mother in a small village.
But that man Radelle had some of his thugs come in and take me.
Kidnapping, is it? Interesting. So why did Radelle want you in particular?
Have a look at this: It's an ancient manuscript I found in Radelle's mansion while I was rescuing Aisha.
It says there's an ancient treasure hidden in the Crouce Ruins—one you need a certain key to get.
This key is said to have been passed down through the generations of a certain family—and I assume you're smart enough to put two and two together here, non?
The key comes from the family of my deceased father, but I don't really know anything about it myself.
So Radelle is after that treasure, eh? Well? What are you going to do?
Do you even need to ask? All treasure must be returned to its rightful place!
Hmph. All right, let me get you a map. But you'll have to figure out the best route for yourself, apprentice.
Wait, you're taking me back to my village? Oh no! I can't ask you to do that!
Returning stolen treasure is ever the duty of the Blue Rose, my dear.
Hmm? Weird, someone's at the door. Store is closed today.
Sorry to butt in, but we're makin' the rounds in this quarter to ask some questions.
The daughter of the head of the Radelle Corporation's been kidnapped. Name's Aisha. The perpetrators are hiding nearby. Happen to know anything?
His DAUGHTER?! Hardly! Plus, that guy is the one who kidnapped ME!
Such a bold-faced lie makes it easier for them to look for you. Still, I'm surprised they managed to track us so quickly.
Radelle is rotten to his core, but he's a good businessman—I'm sure he's got his own information network to leverage.
I'll deal with the jokers at the door. You take the girl out the back.
Merci, I owe you. Let's go, little one.
Hold on, I'm coming. You want some cocoa while you're waiting there?
Buddy, I would LOVE me some cocoa.
Anything over there?
Nope. Even recruited some volunteers to help, but nothing so far.
Radelle's henchmen are everywhere. We'll never make it out of town!
If there's no escape route, we shall just have to make one. Hold on tight, Aisha!
Huh? Aaaaaah!
First we shoot up into the air, and next thing I know, here we are on the roof...
I used a wire to fling us up here. Now we can spirit ourselves from town.
Uh, did you hear something on the roof?
Likely just a rat. But back to the person you're looking for, I can't say I've seen  anyone fitting her description.
Well, we appreciate your help anyway. ...So, Ranzal? Where to next?
I vote we follow them footsteps what we just heard from the roof.
We did it! We made it out of town! That means we're safe, right?
Non. Our pursuers seem the stubborn sort, and I wouldn't be surprised if they're waiting for us in your village.
So there's no escape?
Non again. Not to put too fine a point on it, but Radelle has little interest in YOU— he cares only about your key and the treasure it can lead him to.
But if someone were to steal that treasure, you would hold no further interest for him.
Wait, Lapis, are you saying...?
The Crouce Ruins aren't far. Why don't we just go there and get the treasure?
I told you, I don't know anything about this key everyone seems to want!
Perhaps you do and just don't know it.
Besides, this is my problem now. If I can't put you back in your rightful place, it will damage the good name of the Blue Rose.
Lapis, I...
It's settled, then. To the ruins!
Yeah, we're gonna need ya ladies to hold on for just a tick.
You!
Long time no see, Lapis.
Bonjour, Prince! Fancy meeting you and your bonny companions here.
The head of the Radelle Corporation asked for help finding his kidnapped daughter.
And the kid right there is pretty much a dead ringer for her description.
What have you done, Lapis?
If I told you we're having a tea party, would you believe me?
Yeah, I ain't interested in fallin' for one'a yer clever tricks again, thanks.
Plus, we KNOW yer a thief, so we can't just be lettin' ya go.
Please, wait! I can explain!
Oh?
I'm afraid we lack the time for proper explanations at the moment, child.
No! It's the Radelle company goons!
We're taking you in, Lapis. It's time for you to answer for all of your crimes.
If there truly is an explanation for what you're doing here, we're willing to listen. Perhaps you'll even earn some leniency.
Ah, the classic tough-but-fair approach. But you needn't bother, for I fear I've no intention of being caught.
Ya talk a big game for someone who's outnumbered. Oh, and if yer plannin' to use one'a them smokescreens again, we're ready for it this time.
Oh, I've something else in mind for you, my large friend. ...Voilà!
Aw, sweet cripes! A flash bomb!
Where did they go?!
Damn it! She got away AGAIN! This lady's really startin' to grate my cheese...
I think we're safe for now...
This will prove more difficult than I imagined if the Halidom is involved.
But I am not giving up, for the phantom thief laughs in the face of even the gravest of dangers!
Just like the one who stole me away all those many years ago...
I don't care if you are a prince or Ilia herself—when I hire someone for a job, I expect to see it done.
I'm truly sorry we couldn't recover your daughter.
I don't need apologies, I need results.  You'll be certain to capture the girl this time, I should think?
There's something odd about that man. He speaks of recovering his daughter like she's just a missing oil painting.
And what about that ＂explanation＂ Aisha mentioned?
I'm pickin' up what you're puttin' down, boss. This Radelle cat is more sketchy than a first-year art student's notebook!
Still, that phantom thief is as tricksy as they come. Can't rule out the possibility she's foolin' the kid somehow.
We're clearly still in the dark about a lot of this, but I don't think we got a choice but to chase after the Blue Rose.
Lapis is a criminal, no doubt, but I'm not certain she's a villain.
...Hmm? You want to know why I continue the work of the Blue Rose?
You just seem like a good person, Lapis. I don't understand why you steal.
The acceptable face of justice is not enough to save everyone in this world.
So long as there are those who can bend justice to their will with power and money, people will be lost in the shuffle.
I thought there was nothing to be done... until I met...that person.
Huh? Who?
You see, my parents once ran a black-market auction...
You there! That ring you're selling was my daughter's engagement ring! She was so heartbroken when it was stolen that it cost her her life!
The provenance of this merchandise is not our concern. If you wish to place the ring on your daughter's grave, I suggest you  arrange sufficient funds to bid.
You're a heartless demon!
A heart is not a luxury one can afford in this line of work. ...Get him out of here.
Still up, are we? But tomorrow is your tea party at Count Derci's residence.
We need you making those connections in high society to draw in more clients, you know. ...Stuart! Get in here!
Of course, ma'am. ...Come, I'll escort you back to bed.
Can I have some cocoa, Stuart?
But of course, miss. Er, and I hope it's not too forward of me to ask, but...
What were you thinking about when you overheard all of that just now?
I was thinking about how awful these auctions are. Everything we sell is stolen!
The bidders get the thrill of indulging their guilty pleasures and driving up prices, while the real victims lose out twice.
Do you wish to put an end to your  parents' business, miss?
I once hoped they might have a change of heart, but I know that's a fool's dream.
But many of the auctions' attendees are  powerful people, and when I tried to go public with it...
They buried the matter.
I suppose in this world there are some things you can't change, no matter how unfair or unforgivable. You just have to stand by and watch it all happen.
Here's your hot cocoa, miss. Perhaps it will make you feel better.
Thank you. *sip* ...Are you really Stuart?
Whatever do you mean, miss?
This cocoa has a gentle taste. The Stuart I know could never make cocoa like this.
So I ask again: Who are you, and why are you pretending to be Stuart?
Très bien, miss. Tripped up by my own  commitment to delicious cocoa.
You know what? I'm feeling good—and you complimented my cocoa besides— so I'll let you in on the secret...
Apologies for the ruse, mademoiselle. I am the flower that blooms in twilight! The phantom thief! The Blue Rose!
You're a thief?!
Yes, but my aim is not to simply fill my pockets like a common criminal. Instead, I seek to restore happiness to the world.
All treasure should be returned to its  rightful place—which means all the stolen goods in this mansion belong back with their original owners.
My parents will not like that.
Oui, but of course—which is why I shall swap them out with fakes. I work with a rather skilled forger, you see.
But so long as the auctions continue, there will be ever more victims.
Indeed, which is why my ultimate prey is the criminal enterprise that runs the black market through all South Grastaea. I speak, of course, of ＂Noir Magazin.＂
The auctions run by your parents are but a part of that enterprise. Once it is crushed, the cycle of tragedy can finally end.
Stealing, forging, crushing vast criminal enterprises makes for a rather busy life. Can you really do all of this?
A foolish question, mademoiselle. Why, a person can soar through the sky if they but put their mind to it!
That's impossible.
No need to debate. It's a beautiful starry night, yes? Why don't we both fly out the window and treat ourselves to a late-night rendezvous?
What are you talking abo—AAAAAAH!
(The wind on my face... I AM flying!)
Let's drop on to that church roof for a bit of respite, mmm?
Well, mademoiselle? What did you think of our little rendezvous?
We were just pulled along on a wire, weren't we?
If you want to get technical, yes— but I still think it counts as flying.
If you say something is impossible, I respond that you've given up too easily. Simply change your perspective, and you'll see there's always a way forward.
You can make the impossible possible. I keep going because I believe in myself, no matter how fearsome the foe that might stand astride my path.
Make the impossible possible...
Well then, I'll leave you here to enjoy the church and get back to business.
I'm still not convinced you'll be able to save the entire world.
Well, that simply won't do. However can I convince you?
Steal me away from here. Let me have a firsthand look at you bringing this happiness to the world.
Never been asked to steal a person before, but très bien...
Oui oui, mademoiselle. I shall steal you away like the beautiful rose you are!
From that point on, I helped with the work. We returned stolen treasures and strove to bring down the criminal enterprise.
But you're the Blue Rose now. So what happened to the first one?
Criminals sent assassins.
Eventually, the first Blue Rose took one of them over a cliff and into the sea. He hasn't been seen since.
That is why I decided to take up the name.
I help those who've been stolen from, and work tirelessly to take down my nemesis, Noir Magazin.
So if you succeed, will you stop being the phantom thief?
Oui—but only once there's no one more dangerous than me left in the world.
Come, we've rested long enough. The ruins aren't far now.
Crouce Ruins
How does it look, Lapis?
I did a quick pass through the inside of the ruins, but I didn't see anything that looked even remotely like treasure.
Still, I'd wager there's a hidden chamber somewhere, and your lineage's key is the only way in.
I wonder what the key even IS? I never got anything like that from my fath—EEEEEK!
Never fear, just a rat. It ran off into that crack in the wall.
Sacrebleu!
What is it, Lapis?
There's a space on the other side of that wall—and on THIS side, there is a single hand-shaped indentation.
Aisha, would you mind terribly laying your palm upon it?
Uh, sure?
ANALYZING BIOMETRIC INFORMATION. AUTHORITY FACTOR DETECTED. RELEASING LOCK.
Ah! The wall moved!
It appears your bloodline itself is the key.
Well then, let's head in. I can't wait to see what treasures lie in wait for us!
What is this?
I've seen these used by the imperials. I believe it to be some kind of ancient magical weapon.
So the treasure is...a weapon?
Look there—a stone slate with ancient writing chiseled upon it.
What does it say?
Interesting. It seems these ruins were a laboratory some one thousand years ago.
They were expanding the functionality  of existing armaments here, and the weapon you see there is the result.
B-B-B-BIOMETRIC PRINT IDENTIFIED. AUTOMATIC STARTUP INITIATED... RESUMING EXPERIMENT. WHAT ARE YOUR ORDERS, CHIEF?
Oh my gosh, that thing is TALKING! ...And wait, did it just call me ＂Chief＂?
One of your paternal ancestors must have been responsible for this lab.
COMBAT ORDERS REQUIRED. COMBAT ORDERS REQUIRED. COMBAT ORDERS COMBAT ORDER ORDER ORDER ORRRRRRR...
Uh, this seems bad, right?
Ah ha! THERE ya are, Lapis! ...Wait, what the hell is that?
A guardian sentinel!
Oh, my dear sweet prince. You really followed us all the way out here?
ORDERS NOT CONFIRMED. ENTERING AUTO-COMBAT MODE. LIFE FORMS DETECTED. EXTERMINATING! EXTERMINATING! EXTERMINA—
The hey? It up and disappeared!
Gya! Where did that attack come from?!
Eeeeek! What's HAPPENING?!
Hold on while I deploy a smokescreen!
Well, I'll be a smokin' hot pretzel... There's a silhouette in the smoke!
It's the guardian sentinel!
ALERT. VISIBILITY POOR. ALERT.
Come! We must hide ourselves away while the thing has lost our scent!
What's happening, Lapis? I thought the enemy vanished, but it was actually right there the whole time?
It has been modified with a camouflage mode that allows it to bend light around itself, effectively rendering it invisible.
How in blazes do ya know all this?
From this stone slate. But it's clearly been sitting here for so long it's malfunctioning. It's attacking whatever it sees.
If it leaves the ruins, chaos will ensue. We must stop it.
But how do ya fight somethin' what ya can't even see?
Couldn't we just use smoke like before to at least see its outline?
I'm afraid that was my last smokescreen. But I have another idea...
Prince, you and Ranzal do what you can do draw its attention. This will give me an idea of where it is located.
Once I've confirmed the enemy position, I'll blow it away with my manacaster.
I really hate the first part'a this plan. How the hell do we know ya won't just head for the hills the moment we step out and start distractin' it?!
You think Lapis would abandon you?
Crossed my mind, yeah. She's a THIEF, kid! She ain't got no moral code!
You're not wrong to be suspicious. There's no way I could ask you to trust me.
But if you think about it...what other choice do you really have?
She's right, Ranzal. If we don't trust her, this thing is going to break out of here and ravage the surrounding area.
Besides, if Lapis DOES run away, it just means we're in the same situation we would have been in anyway.
Wow, that's bleak. But yeah, I getcha. Oh, and Lapis? I ain't the kinda man what forgets a double-cross—or forgives it. Ya hear what I'm sayin'?
Merci to you both. Let us commence!
Hey, chump! Try some'a this!
Okay, we got its attention—now we just need to keep avoiding its attacks!
The enemy is attacking while moving, making it hard for it to aim.
Oh no! One of its shots hit that wall and it's coming down!
Lapis!
Damn, I can't see Lapis anywhere! There's too much dust!
Dust... That's it! Attack the walls to kick up more dust!
I see it! It's right there!
Gah! I barely made a dent...
Crap, the dust is clearin'! We're gonna lose it again!
Oh, I never let my prey get away. Au revoir, mon rocky ami.
It's down! The guardian sentinel is down! But where did that attack COME from?
I'm rather good with a caster, wouldn't you say?
Lapis! You're alive!
Side-stepping a collapsing wall is a simple matter for one such as I.
But I must say, well done, my prince. Using the dust to suss out the enemy was quite clever indeed.
I guess it just sort of came to me.
Quick on your feet, a good judge of  character, and as righteous as ever. Oh, what a fine prince you are!
Why, I've half a mind to let you  capture me...
Our friends from the Halidom have returned with the girl and the phantom thief, Mr. Radelle.
Bring both of the women to me. Our Halidom friends are dismissed.
Aisha, your little escapade has cost me quite a bit of money, and I will have my compensation—I don't think you're ever going to see your home again.
Rather than scowling in silence, perhaps you should apologi... Hmm?
Quite the thing to say, seeing how you kidnapped her so you could get your meaty paws on the ruin's treasure.
So Aisha told you about that, did she? In that case, it won't do to simply turn you over to the proper authorities.
On the other hand, I've heard and seen a great deal of you lately, and find myself quite impressed with your work.
So as a show of respect, I will offer you a choice: You can come work for me, or I can kill you where you stand.
Alas, I don't like either of those choices. I only steal what my heart tells me to.
Oh, but I DO owe you one apology. The treasure in the ruins? It was a special magic weapon, but it ran amok, so I'm afraid I had to smash it.
You WHAT?!
Ah, but do not fret! I brought you back some of the wreckage as a souvenir. Would you care to take a look?
Do you have any idea how much that was WORTH, you daft imbecile?!
No clue. But I DO know that I couldn't allow it to get loose into the world.
Still, I doubt you wanted it just for your collection room. What WAS your aim?
Money, of course. There would be not a shortage of buyers for a unique weapon like that. I could have named my price!
But the ancient documents I took from your mansion didn't say what the treasure WAS. So how did you know?
One of my ancestors worked in that lab; knowledge of its existence has been passed down through my family.
Sadly, they were but a rank-and-file staff member, and lacked the necessary permissions to open the door.
Ah, but I do love it when the last puzzle piece clicks into place.
Is your question time over already? I would be happy to keep talking and give you something to ponder out there in the great beyond.
Oh, how kind. Well, let us see... Is there anything you want to ask moi?
Stop. I've seen more than enough.
That voice is...a man? Who ARE you?!
It seems Lapis and Aisha's explanation was completely true.
You're that damn Halidom prince!
Aren't my makeup skills something?
Apologies for the ruse, but I really needed our dear prince here to see firsthand just how truly awful you are.
I'm afraid you're coming with us to stand trial.
Hmph. Well, this may be a surprise... but sadly for you, it is not frightening. You DO know where you are, yes?
Oh dear. Surrounded by rough-looking  customers once again. Prince, I dare say it's about that time, don't you think?
For the bomb you gave me? Indeed it is.
My subordinates have already informed me about your little ＂light bomb,＂ dear.
So long as we don't look directly at it, we will be fine—and once the light subsides, it is all over for you.
If we were trying to escape, you'd be right. But this time it's just the signal for our counterattack.
Are you ALL from the Halidom?! Wh-where did you come from?!
Now who's getting forgetful? Your mansion is connected to those secret tunnels, remember? They've been waiting there.
Oh, and we heard everything ya said through the walls.
Anyway, looks like yer all pretty stunned right now, so...GET 'EM!
Are you still itching for that fight?
Damn you!
I've arranged for Aisha to be taken to her village.
The stolen goods from Radelle's mansion are being divided up and returned to their rightful owners.
Merci! I knew I wouldn't regret mixing you up in all of this.
Radelle has been exposed, Aisha is safe, and the stolen goods are being returned.
It is a happy finale for all.
Er, not quite. Now that everything's settled, might I convince you to turn yourself in?
Aisha told me everything—including why you continue the phantom thief's work, and the criminal enterprise you're fighting.
But I don't think your methods are right. You cause far too much distress.
I want you to make amends for what you've done. And in the meantime, we can continue your work helping victims and fighting this Noir Magazin.
If I say non, will you attempt to take me in by force?
I know you're not a bad person, but I can't stand by and...
I understand. You are a prince, and must embody justice as this world defines it.
Stay true to what you believe, and I will do the same.
For I believe the path I've inherited will bring joy to this world.
Another smokescreen!? L-LAPIS! *cough* *hack* *wheeeeze*
Au revoir, sweet prince.
I can't believe I fell for that again... Hmm? What's this? A card?
Thank you for everything. Though I must say, I hate being indebted to people.
So if you ever need aid, but say the word. —The Blue Rose
Lapis...
The Blue Rose has left a proclamation! We must protect the treasure!
Things are heating up in here, so I suppose it's time to start the show!
With dignity and beauty, I shall make the impossible possible...
For I am the Blue Rose!
